description: This Grade I listed Jacobean Manor House is set in a fine estate. Built by Sir Nicholas Rainton, Lord Mayor of London 1632-33, as a family home, it is presented as a multi period House with interesting features from different centuries.

factsheet.heading: History
paragraphs:
A rare opportunity to see architectural features in the Cellar of magnificent Forty Hall that reveal changes made to Forty Hall over the centuries.
A perfect visit for architecture enthusiasts and those just wishing to see a cool space thatâ€™s not on the usual visitor trail!

Please note that floor in the Cellar is uneven. Access via lift is possible, however the Cellar is not suitable for wheelchair users. Please wear suitable clothing and footwear otherwise you may not be permitted to view the Cellar.

travel_info: Train: Enfield Town, Turkey Street, Enfield Chase
Additional travel info: 191 or W10 to roundabout at Myddelton Avenue and then 10 minute walk up Forty Hill.

name: Forty Hall Estate
